{"step_by_step_thinking": "Familial transmission refers to the passing on of behaviors, traits, or patterns from parents to offspring. Drinking patterns can be influenced by a variety of factors, including genetic predisposition, environmental factors, and learned behaviors. Research has shown that children of parents who have problematic drinking behaviors are more likely to develop similar patterns. This suggests that familial transmission of drinking patterns can indeed persist into young adulthood.", "answer_choice": "A"}
